page.title: 07INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: { {Interview with Mr. A. Jones, 86, {Soughton Villager,born June 1899- {reporter M. St-Amour. We talked to Mr Jones about his work in the Soughton co-operative shop. Mr Jones came to Soughton School as an infant, then to Northop School because Soughton didn't have room for Juniors then. He worked at the aged of 7 in the Co-op after school hours. There were no working hours; he went home when the Manager said he could go home. He had sixpence a week wages. He left school when he was twelve. He eventually became manager of the Co-op in Caernarvon. He said Soughton has made a change for the better. His father worked in the mine for 15 shillings a week. Mr Jones opened the new Co-op in Soughton but the shop has since closed down.
